narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic Polish conversational phrases and forms.
An introduction to Polish language and culture.
I learned alot about Polish grammar and an introduction to the language including basic phrases.
Basic Polish understanding and knowledge
I learned how to converse and conjugate in Polish. I also learned about Polish history and influential people.
I learned the foundation of the Polish language.
introductory polish words and conversations
Fundamentals and basics of Polish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course did an excellent job of facilitating language acquisition through emphasising repetition and effective in-class and homework exercises.

This course has a very manageable course load and was always enjoyable. Krystyna is an extremely nice professor and works with her students in order to ensure they get the most from the class. She has a lot of passion for teaching Polish and integrates Polish history, art, and culture into the class. The one weakness of the course is that it can feel too repetitive at times and is very contingent on other students in the class keeping up with work and progress.
More structure

strengths: good repetition and practice. relevant coursework and methodically go through the textbook
weakness: slow and can be unengaging
Instructor was very kind and well taught.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have an interest in learning Polish, then yes!
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. The workload is light, class is interesting and interactive, and Krystyna is an amazing professor.
Yes a welcoming environment to learn a new language.
Yes, if you want to learn polish
Yes. The professor is amazing and it is a very positive learning atmosphere.
yes. Professor Krystyna is very kind, excited about what she teaches, and understanding.
Yes, good class.
